measured_by: proportion of mentions of the current referent compared to all mentions within a text
justification: "Global topicality is approximated by considering frequency of mention … implemented as the proportion of mentions of the current referent compared to all mentions of all referents within a text"

measured_by: number of clauses (out of the 10 following clauses) in which the referent re-occurs
justification: "Topic persistence is reflected in the number of clauses out of 10 clauses subsequent to a current mention which mention a given discourse referent."

measured_by: number of clauses (out of the 10 preceding clauses) that mention the referent
justification: "Topic salience is reflected in the number of clauses out of 10 clauses preceding a current mention of a given discourse referent."

measured_by: average number of discourse referents per clause (globally) or the number of discourse referents in the last three clauses (locally)
justification: "Information pressure captures the density of discourse referents either globally as the average number of discourse referents per clause … or locally as the number of discourse referents mentioned in the last three clauses."

measured_by: GRAID coding of argument role (S, A, P, etc.) for the referent
justification: "Syntactic function has been found to correlate with types of referent expression … and is taken from the GRAID annotation (form, humanness, syntactic function)."

measured_by: relative position (before/after) of the referent expression with respect to the verb in its clause
justification: "Verb position captures the position of a referent expression relative to the verb within a sentence."

measured_by: number of word forms in the clause excluding the referent expression
justification: "Clause length is measured in number of word forms, excluding the referent expression in question."

measured_by: syntactic classification of the clause (independent, adverbial, relative, complement) where the referent occurs
justification: "Clause type registers whether a referent expression occurs in an independent, adverbial, relative, and complement clause."

measured_by: count of new referent introductions within the clause
justification: "Number of discourse-new referents in a single clause unit is also included … clauses have been shown to exhibit maximally one new referent."
construct: Number of discourse-new referents in clause

measured_by: binary indicator of whether morphological agreement with the argument is marked on the predicate
justification: "Agreement is operationalized here as the presence or absence of a morphological marker within the predicative phrase that co-expresses the grammatical person, number and/or gender of an argument."

measured_by: binary feature indicating +/- human for the discourse referent
justification: "Humanness is captured as a binary feature [+/-human]."

measured_by: binary feature indicating +/- singular for the referent
justification: "Number is captured as a binary feature [+/-singular]."

measured_by: number of clauses between the current mention and its antecedent
justification: "Anaphoric distance, or recency, is measured in the number of clauses between a current mention of a discourse referent and its antecedent mention."

measured_by: categorical value capturing whether the antecedent was NP, pronoun, or zero
justification: "Antecedent form resembles the form type (NP, pro, 0) of an antecedent."

measured_by: binary flag indicating whether the referent has been previously mentioned in the discourse
justification: "Discourse-givenness captures whether a referent is the first instance of a discourse referent in a given discourse, with possible values of [+/-given]."
